IO Performance Verifier
IO Performance verifier is for verifying IO from fx SAN/NAS in a virtualized environment on Windows servers. Useful to verify SLA or configuration change effect
With servers running on virtualized machines with SAN/NAS it is very difficult to test if a SAN/NAS can take the pressure put on the server and when it breaks.

An additional problem can be to have a reliable way to retest when configurations have been changed.

This project is making the assumption that there is a somewhat linear increase in the IO for what pressure you put on the server fx a server in a production system handling 1.000 items a minute has a 1/10 the IO pressure of a server handling 10.000 items.

This linearity is used to take a pressure recorded at a production or test server handling 100 items per minute and using that to scale the IO pressure to 10.000 items per minute to test if the SAN/NAS can handle it.
